name: Hilton Galveston Island Resort

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little leery of booking this hotel. I am a hotel aficionado...and very hard to please. I don't have one single bad thing to say. The rooms were clean and very nice. The bathroom had good lighting and was very clean. (Even the balcony, chairs and table were clean!) The staff is truly amazing. Someone had broken a beer bottle in the hallway by the stairs. We told one of the housekeepers and she immediately stopped what she was doing and went and cleaned it up. I don't think I saw one staff member that wasn't smiling. The lobby is nice and inviting. The bartender at the swim up bar on Thursday was great. She was quick and very pleasant to talk to. (Wednesday's bartender was a little slow...but very nice.) We had great appetizers by the pool and enjoyed ourselves immensely. Parking, pool towels, waiters and waitresses, drinks, and help were readily available anytime we needed anything. Very impressed. We will be staying there again. Definitely.
reviews.title: No complaints from a complainer!

reviews.text: We stayed during the spring break "madness" and the staff managed to do a great job at keeping the hotel, lobby, and pool area very clean and the service at times was slower but the entire staff was working very hard and super friendly. Our room was your average hotel room you would expect from a Hilton...nice and clean. What really made our stay however was the staff...everyone from the front desk, bar tender, bellman, waiters and restaurant staff really took the time to make sure everything was perfect and they were always fast, friendly, and attentive. They not only treated us that way..but I saw how they treated our 12 year old son while I was sitting in the lobby and he went up to ask for a soda at the lobby bar and for some brochures at the front desk....the staff gave him the same greeting and service that they would to an arriving dignitary. Its great to stay at a place where everyone treats you so well and the hotel and amenities are clean and all functioning. Also...the location is excellent...right on the seawall and near some great places to eat and the price we paid for our stay was a bargain for the quality of the experience.
reviews.title: service is outstanding from everyone on staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel prior to departing for a cruise out of Galveston. The location is directly across from the beach. The day we stayed, Sat. March 2, 2013 if was very cold and windy so did not walk on the beach. Although we did not take advantage of the beautiful pool, I understand from other guests that is was a heated pool and very pleasant.
reviews.title: Great Pre-Cruise Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a King Balcony room that was comfortable. The only complaint is that the sliding door had a leaky seal and the wind noise was very annoying. My husband, being very handy, figured out how to block the wind around the door. Otherwise it would have been a very sleepless night.
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: The front desk staff and bellmen were excellent. Friendly, courteous and helpful with advice on getting the shuttle to the cruise port. The shuttle staff were very organized and efficient at loading the shuttle and getting us to the port in record time. The hotel provides free transport to the cruiseship. Although we did not bring our vehicle, I understand you could park in their longterm lot for no extra fee, while you were on the cruise.
reviews.title: just o.k. hotel

reviews.text: We loved our spacious room, the service was great and they have a free shuttle to the Cruise Port. Rainforest cafe next door had a free shuttle to Pleasure Pier. The Hotel even shuttled us to Moody Gardens for free ( just don't forget to tip the friendly helpful driver!)
reviews.title: Great place to stay pre-cruise

reviews.text: I took my daughter and her friends to the galveston for her birthday. When we entered the girls room the floor was soaking wet. They brought heavy fans and carpet cleaners up to the room. This was very inconveinent. When we were leaving I told the girls to shake the sheets to make sure we did not leave anything. A cherry tomato fell out of the sheets. We had not eaten in the room. Not a pleasant experience. The customer service is very good. The pool is very nice. The hotel needs to improve its standard of cleanliness.
reviews.title: Tomato in bed sheets
Outstanding staff
reviews.text: This is the best staff I have ever encountered in my travels in the U.S. They were all so helpful. They all were smiling and were extremely kind to my sister who needed extra patience and help. Everyone from the person who checked us in to the lady who cleaned the room asked if there was anything they could help us with. I loved that about this hotel.
Hilton is a great place to have conference, to spend vacation and where i like to go back there.

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel and would stay again when we get back down .
reviews.title: Good Spring Break spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a very good location. Easy access to the beach, resteraunts and sights. We were in walking distance to quite a bit. Since it was a bit chilly and windy the beaches were not crowded. We had a very good time dispite the weather. The hotel was quiet, clean and comfortable. Missed having access to internet
reviews.title: Very clean and comfortable. Easy access to beach and island amentities.

reviews.text: We stayed one night before taking a Disney Cruise to Bahamas.
reviews.title: Good option for cruise travelers

reviews.text: Clean rooms, service is very good. The concierge at the door excelled at his job. He would go the extra mile to accommodate your needs. He would offer you bottled iced water or cookies for the kids. Always ready to give you a good tip or tell you where the shops were or where is the best place for dinner.
reviews.title: Average service, high dollar price tag

reviews.text: The hotel is next to a Rainforest Cafe and even though it is not the cheapest option to have dinner before you go on your cruise, the hotel had coupons for free meals for the kids with the purchase of an entree.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walmart is located 2 long blocks away if you have to buy the last minute thing. It was a 7 minute walk. If walking is not an option for you, then you're looking at $10 minimum for the 2 minute cab ride. You also have a grocery store that sells alcohol next door ( we opted for Walmart though).
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: If you're looking for a middle of the road, clean and well kept hotel option for a night or two if your taking a cruise you an go wrong at the Hilton in Galveston.
reviews.title: Great location and nice rooms, but eat somewhere else.

description: Unwind at Hilton Galveston Island Resort and enjoy a premier oceanfront location overlooking the Gulf of Mexico. Situated on the historic Seawall Boulevard at the 32-acre San Luis Resort, this Galveston hotel is within close walking distance of the beach, fishing piers, shopping and restaurants. Relax in a cozy guest room with elegant, ocean-inspired decor and marvel at breathtaking sea views form a private balcony, or choose a suite with separate living space.
